article.headline: Longwood 93, Hartford 90 (OT)
article.story: FARMVILLE, Va. (AP) -- Clayton Morgan scored seven of his 20 points in overtime and Lamar Barrett adeded six of his 18 Saturday as Longwood beat Hartford 93-90. The Lancers (4-16), who saw a 3-point lead at the end of regulation wiped out by Aaron Cook's 3-pointer with 6 seconds left, took an 85-83 lead with 1:40 left in overtime on Barrett's layup and got a 3-pointer from Morgan 37 seconds later. Hartford (7-12) pulled to within a point twice in the final 8 seconds, but Morgan made two free throws with 8 seconds to play, making Kenny Adeleke's layup with less than a second to play harmless. Morgan added two free throws after the buzzer. Adeleke had a career-high 31 points and 15 rebounds for Hartford, and Cook matched his career high by scoring 29. David Ruffin and Rich baker each scored 11. Morgan also had 12 rebounds and five assists for the Lancers, and Maurice Sumter scored 23 as Longwood snapped a five-game losing streak.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
